page.title: 11Education in Escrick.
page.content: We have two schools in our area.One, Queen Margaret's School is an independent girls'school,the other,a Church of England primary school is run by the local education authority. Escrick Primary School has about 80 pupils,but numbers are decreasing annually as the birth_rate declines. The school is in 2 parts,separated by a playing field.The infants,aged 4-7 years are in a modern block which has 29 children in 2 classes.The 2 junior classes with pupils aged 7-11 years are housed in the old building which used to be a barn for Escrick Estate, but which has been used as a school for over 100 years.The infants' building was to be extended to incorporate the juniors but financial cutbacks and falling roles stopped further building.Pupils aged 11+ travel daily to Fulford Comprehensive.
